channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: EU foreign ministers meet ahead of Trump-Putin talks in Alaska
item.description: EU foreign ministers meet ahead of Friday's Trump-Putin talks in Alaska, with Brussels insisting any peace deal must include Ukraine.

item.title: Women who have experienced stalking have a higher risk of heart disease, study shows
item.description: A big, new study shows women who are victims of stalking are at significantly higher risk of heart disease.

item.title: U.S. famine warning system comes back, but questions loom
item.description: After the U.S. early famine warning systems went dark earlier in 2025, the lights are back on. But questions remain about whether it will be as effective as before and whether it will be politicized.

item.title: NPR's Jack Corbett on playing the lead role in the new movie 'Boys Go to Jupiter'
item.description: Jack Corbett, best known as the Planet Money TikTok guy, makes his film debut in Boys Go To Jupiter this summer. The animated feature's lead role, Billy 5000, was written specifically for Corbett.

item.title: Trump is taking over D.C. police and sending in the National Guard. Locals are furious
item.description: President Trump says he's deploying hundreds of National Guard troops to Washington, D.C. But the latest official figures show that crime rates have fallen dramatically in the city.

item.title: CDC staffers react to Friday shooting
item.description: On Friday, a gunman opened fire on the CDC campus in Atlanta and a police officer was killed. The shooting has left employees uncertain about how safe they are at their jobs.

item.title: To save the Mojave Desert tortoise, protect the desert landscape, researchers say
item.description: Researchers are working to save a tortoise that has been in the American southwest for millions of years. California has moved to put extra protections in place for the Mojave Desert tortoise.

item.title: Father James Martin is okay with not being liked
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Father James Martin talks about letting go of his idea that God was transactional.

item.title: President Trump deploys National Guard to D.C., takes control of Police Department
item.description: President Trump has taken over D.C.'s police force and plans to send in National Guard troops. It's part of his plan to slash what he says is out-of-control crime, though the numbers say otherwise.

item.title: Alaska was once a full-fledged Russian colony. Now it will host a U.S.-Russia summit
item.description: Presidents Trump and Putin will meet in Alaska to talk about a costly Russian war involving Crimea, bringing up parallels of the circumstances that led Russia to sell Alaska to the U.S. in the 1800s.
